section: Exercise 4.12.4: Lining up a wedding party for a photo.
instructions: Ten members of a wedding party are lining up in a row for a photograph.
question:
(a)

How many ways are there for the wedding party to line up in which the bride is not next to the groom?
answer:
There are 10! ways to line up the ten people in the wedding party if there are no restrictions
on how the people are placed. As shown earlier, the number of ways to line up the ten people in the
wedding party in which the bride and the groom are next to each other is 2·9!.
Therefore  the number of ways to line up the ten people in the wedding party in which the
bride is not next to the groom is 10! - 2·9! = 8·9!.
